subject: Re: [junit] Testing inner classes with junitx
msgSnippet: Hi! Depending on modifies(static or non static) for Pair class, you may need to use OuterClass. new Pair() new OutClass.Pair() etc to create an object of Pair
messageBody:
Hi!

Depending on modifies(static or non static) for Pair class, you may need
to use OuterClass. new Pair() new OutClass.Pair() etc to create an
object of Pair class.

Regards,
Nagendra

Leila wrote:

>
> I have no idea where to start. Since the following
> code would not compile:
> Pair p = (Pair) invoke(d, "mostFlexible", new Object[]
> { mcss });
> Pair (the inner class) is not recognized in junitx
> test.
>
>
>
> --- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@...> wrote:
>
> > Leila wrote:
> >
> > > Does anyone know if inner classes can be tested
> > with
> > > junitx? I need to test a private method that
> > returns
> > > an instance of an inner class.
> >
> > Have you tried it?
> > --
> > J. B. Rainsberger,
> > Diaspar Software Services
> > http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
> > Let's write software that people understand
> >
>
>
>
